main event: Radar operators detected an unidentified target that made several abrupt changes in course and speed during a 10-minute observation period on August 3, 1951 near Kentland, Indiana.
interesting points: The target was tracked on radar but could not be identified as any known type of aircraft.
The target's movements and performance characteristics were inconsistent with any known aircraft.
Radar operators were experienced and reliable, indicating the sighting was authentic.
There was no visual sighting or photograph of the object.
The possibility that it may have been a remote controlled or radio controlled model was considered, but deemed unlikely due to the size and maneuverability of the target.
